{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328839,"name":"Fedor Leonov","username":"fedorlspp26","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fedorlspp26/{size}/240103_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T03:08:30.187Z","cooked":"

Hello! We are running a Limelight 3 flashed with Photonvision on our robot. We managed to calibrate it successfully and use it in our codebase, but the NetworkTables keep disconnecting and reconnecting. Also, whenever we try to use any high resolutions, the Limelight crashes and I have to power cycle it. Any help? Thank you!

What version of WPILib are you using? You can find this in either build.gradle or the WPILib show project info command. Upgrading to 2024.3.1 is recommended (and should fix the NT issue) if you aren’t using it yet.

We are using WPILib 2024.3.1. Not sure what to do here.

Hello

Could a Network Table bug be playing a role with the symptoms described in post #7 of that thread:

PhotonVision OjectDetection camera sometimes missing on boot - Technical / PhotonVision - Chief Delphi

Thanks!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T11:05:53.340Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458103,"topic_slug":"limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors","display_username":"gartaud","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/photonvision-ojectdetection-camera-sometimes-missing-on-boot/458083/7","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"PhotonVision OjectDetection camera sometimes missing on boot","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31686,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Mentor, 1089 & 2495"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors/458103/4","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Mentor, 1089 & 2495","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3329872,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T14:04:11.936Z","cooked":"

Unlikely. The only part NT plays in camera streams is communicating the URL of the stream. The stream itself goes over a separate HTTP connection.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T14:04:11.936Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":28.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458103,"topic_slug":"limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31686,"username":"gartaud","name":"gartaud","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors/458103/5","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3329965,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T15:26:58.722Z","cooked":"

Generally disconnect loops on 3.1 are due to the server (which is running as part of the robot program) not being able to keep up with the amount of data being sent–this is generally due to some combination of heavy CPU use by the main part of the robot code or very large amounts of data updates occurring on NT. Are you using AdvantageKit or otherwise doing large amounts of logging?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T15:27:26.677Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458103,"topic_slug":"limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55420,"username":"fedorlspp26","name":"Fedor Leonov","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fedorlspp26/{size}/240103_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors/458103/6","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3331162,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T15:43:10.181Z","cooked":"

Are you using the second port on the radio? There’s a known issue where sometimes this port fails to function.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T15:43:10.181Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458103,"topic_slug":"limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-w-photonvision-crashing-with-network-table-errors/458103/7","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3331212,"name":"Fedor Leonov","username":"fedorlspp26","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fedorlspp26/{size}/240103_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T16:23:57.280Z","cooked":"

Fixed! We first stopped using the second port on the radio (dubbed the Evil Port). However, this did not fix the issue. We decided to use a static IP, which fixed the issue.
